reviewText: This is an inspiring movie that struck the right chord when I was a pre-teen. So, I'm really glad to have had the opportunity to watch it again. It's based on the life of Bobbie Dean, a boyish girl with excellent skills to play basketball. The thing is that she is not supposed to play "real" basketball (just the soft adapted version for girls) and her only dream is to do so.

This movie was an awesome movie for young girls.  The lead character, Bobby, is amazing as she and her family fight for her to be allowed play basketball with the boys in 1964.  Great reminder that we all need help in reaching for our dreams... And that giving up should never be an option.  Watched this with my 12, 10 and 6 year old daughters.  they loved it, too!
I was thrilled to find this DVD. My daughter and her friends were extras and we never had a coy
